sample_rows.title: Double coupling
sample_rows.publication_description: Reference to international publication in German

sample_rows.title: Heating device of a fuel cell vehicle
sample_rows.abstract: A heating device of a fuel cell vehicle comprising a fuel cell for generating electricity by a chemical reaction of oxygen and hydrogen, a cathode exhaust passage through which outside air introduced and supplied to the cathode electrode of the fuel cell to be used for the power generation reaction is exhausted from the fuel cell and an anode outlet duct through which the hydrogen is discharged from the fuel cell,  wherein the heating device comprises:  a branch duct which is branched off from a branch point of the cathode outlet duct and which supplies the air discharged from the fuel cell to a vehicle passenger compartment,  wherein the anode outlet channel is connected to the cathode outlet channel on a downstream side of the branch point.

sample_rows.title: Method for cutting and laying carpet tiles on a floor of a mass transit vehicle
sample_rows.publication_description: Modified first page translated EP/WO patent

sample_rows.title: manufacturing device
sample_rows.abstract: A manufacturing apparatus is provided which can realize a so-called sequential substrate transport and improve the throughput even if a single multi-layer thin layer contains multiple layers of the same type of layer. In one embodiment, the manufacturing apparatus includes a transport chamber (12), three sputter deposition chambers (13A, 13C, 13E) each containing exactly one sputtering cathode, two sputter deposition chambers (13B, 13D) each containing two or more sputter cathodes, and a process chamber (14 ) for performing a process other than sputtering, wherein the three sputter-depositing chambers (13A, 13C, 13E), the two sputter-depositing chambers (13B, 13D) and the processing chamber (14) are arranged around the transporting chamber (12) so as to be capable of each is to perform delivery and acceptance of the substrate with the transport chamber (12).

sample_rows.title: Dependency-based impact analysis using a multi-dimensional model of a software offering
sample_rows.abstract: The disclosed embodiments provide a system that simplifies the maintenance and execution of a software offering. During operation, the system obtains model data associated with a multi-dimensional model of the software offering. The system then uses the model data to calculate a set of dependency weights representing measures of dependency among a set of service components and a set of resources used by the software offering. Finally, the system uses the dependency weights to facilitate management of the software offering.
